intro: Serrafalcus squarrosus subsp. villosus, commonly known as the hairy serrafalcus, is a lesser-known plant species characterized by its distinctive, serrated leaves. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is native to specific regions in South America. The subspecies villosus is distinguished by its dense, hairy foliage, which provides a unique texture and appearance. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
